cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CYBER. 

The paper deals with a mathematical model describing social networks and the spread of fake news, which falls under the category of social informatics (cs.SI) and social computing (cs.SOC). The model also involves agents updating their beliefs based on observations, which is a common theme in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper discusses the impact of varying the learning horizon, which could be relevant to cybersecurity (cs.CYBER) and the study of dynamic systems.
